rule.note: Add language to URL if not present
Add the key of the site if it was resolved by server name, and if URL does not start with /users or /sites

rule.name: Add the /cms/render/live part
rule.note: Prepend /cms/render/live to all page requests, which do not have it yet
Add the key of the site if it was resolved by server name, and if URL does not start with /sites

outbound-rule.name: Perform outbound URL analysis
outbound-rule.note:
Main analysis of the outbound URL (link in the generated HTML response) is done here.
Checks if the target site key in the processed URL is mapped to the current server name. If yes, it sets the request variable jahiaSiteKeyMatchesCurrentServerName to true.
If the language in the URL matches the default language of the target site, sets jahiaSiteKeyMatchesDefaultLanguage to true. In such case the jahiaSeoLanguageToken is set to an empty string. Otherwise the jahiaSeoLanguageToken is set to e.g. "/en" for English.
If the /cms prefix should be removed (if the removal is not disabled by setting urlRewriteRemoveCmsPrefix to false in jahia.properties) and the following path is not starting with the reserved keyword, the jahiaSeoCmsToken attribute will be set to an empty string. Othewise it will be set to /cms to preserve the prefix.

outbound-rule.name: Handle link to a resource of same site
outbound-rule.note: Removes the site key from the URL if the current server name is mapped to this site. Removes the language token if it is the default language of the site.

outbound-rule.name: Handles link to a resource of another site: keep hostname
outbound-rule.note: A link is to a resource on another site. Keeps the site key in the URL. Removes the language token if it is the default language of the target site.

outbound-rule.name: Handles link to a resource of another site: switch hostname
outbound-rule.note: Removes the site key from the URL and changes the server name. Removes the language token if it is the default language of the target site. Removes the /render/live part. Removes the /cms part if not disabled and in case the following path does not start with a reserved prefix.

outbound-rule.name: Perform outbound URL analysis (URLs with vanity mappings)
outbound-rule.note: Those URLs were not modified by the previous rules. Will check if the /cms should and can be removed.

outbound-rule.name: Remove the /cms/render/live part
outbound-rule.note: Removes the /render/live part for remaining URLs and /cms if not disabled and if the path does not start with a reserved word.

outbound-rule.name: Perform outbound URL analysis on files link
outbound-rule.note:
Main analysis of the outbound URL (link in the generated HTML response) is done here.
Checks if the target site key in the processed URL is mapped to the current server name. If yes, it sets the request variable jahiaSiteKeyMatchesCurrentServerName to true.

outbound-rule.name: Handle files link to a resource of same site
outbound-rule.note: Removes the site key from the URL if the current server name is mapped to this site.

outbound-rule.name: Handles files link to a resource of another site: switch hostname
outbound-rule.note: Removes the site key from the URL and changes the server name. Removes the /live part.
